name: Himu
review: Oaty but light, with a slightly buttery taste and a pleasingly crumbly texture. Can't beat it really. Classic taste. It's one of my favourites. Best dunked briefly to avoid disaster!

name: Nipa
review: A classic. Almost. Crumbly and with just enough chocolate, these are great with any cuppa, but they take on a whole new fresh-tasting, mint-choc dimension when infused with T&B’s Peppermint tea!

name: Setu
review: These sweet and spicy biscuits are a match made in heaven for T&B’s Ginger and Lemon tea. Soft, smooth and peppery when dunked, this winning combination makes for a zingy afternoon pick-me-up!

name: Aditi
review: Soft and crumbly when briefly dunked, and with a satisfying hit of chocolate, these cookies would also pair perfectly with T&B’s Spanish Orange tea.

name: Anika
review: This shortbread biscuit - 'The Best', apparently - is nice and crumbly with a good buttery. However the slow bake seems to have dried out the biscuit and I wish, it was a little bit sweeter with some sugar on top of the biscuit.

name: Piu
review: This is light and nutty, with a hazelnut front taste and almost pistachio finish. Really good with my Regal Chai this morning. Absorbs tea quickly yet during the dunk test keeps its crunchiness. Not bad at all.
